Readings

As the course progresses, we will post papers we find interesting or that we specifically mention in class.

Nothing in Biology Makes Sense Except in the Light of Evolution

by Theodosius Dobzhansky. in The American Biology Teacher, 35(3) 1973.

•Publisher

•PDF

Humans as the World's Greatest Evolutionary Force

by Stephen R. Palumbi. in Science, 293(5536) 2001.

•Publisher

•PDF

Trophic Downgrading of Planet Earth

by James A. Estes, John Terbough, Justin S. Brashares, Mary E. Power, Joel Berger, William J. Bond, Stephen R. Carpenter, Timothy E. Essington, Robert D. Holt, Jeremy B.C. Jackson, Robert J. Marquis, Lauri Oksanen, Tarja Oksanen, Robert T. Paine, Ellen K. Pikitch, Williiam J. Ripple, Stuart A. Sandin, Martin Scheffer, Thomas W. Schoener, Jonathan B. Shurin, Anthony E. Sinclair, Michael E. Soulé, Risto Virtanen, and David A. Wardle in Science, 333(6040) 2011.

•Publisher

•PDF

Experiments in Plant Hybridization

by Gregor Mendel in Proceedings of the Natural History Society of Brünn, 1865.

•Publisher

•PDF

The Orgin(s) of Whales

by Mark D. Uhen in Annual Review of Earth and Planetary Sciences, 2010.

•Publisher

•PDF

Divergence, Convergence, and the Ancestry of Feral Populations in the Domestic Rock Pigeon

by Sydney A. Stringham, Elisabeth E. Mulroy, Jinchuan Xing, David Record, Michael W. Guernsey, Jaclyn T. Aldenhoven, Edward J. Osborne, and Michael D. Shapiro in Current Biology, 2012.

•Publisher

•PDF

Contingency, convergence and hyper-astronomical numbers in biological evolution

by Ard A. Louis in Studies in History and Philosophy of Biological and Biomedical Sciences, 2016.

•Publisher
